title: A Beginner's Guide To Meditation And Its Benefits
summary: Meditation is the act of sitting down with the goal of focusing on one thing only – your breath. The goal is to silence the mind and get it off the constant thinking so you can relax and bring your stress levels down. There are different types of meditation, but they all have the same goal – to bring you peace and calmness inside. There’s no right or wrong way of doing it – you can sit on the floor, in a chair or even lie down if that’�s more comfortable for you.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The idea of sitting still and focusing on your breathing might sound a bit too challenging at first, but meditation is actually much simpler than you might think. If you\u2019ve been struggling to find balance in your life and keep your stress levels under control, meditation is just what you need. As we go through this hectic world, our minds are constantly racing from one thought to another without even noticing. Most of us have a hard time dealing with the pressures of everyday life, which is why meditation can be such a great tool for clearing our mind and finding peace once again. It also helps reduce stress, lift our mood, increase self-awareness and make us more compassionate human beings. So if you\u2019re ready to adopt the practice of meditation in your life on a regular basis, read on \u2013 we\u2019ve got all the details you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

Get your mind to \u201Cshut up\u201D so it doesn\u2019t start thinking about other things."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If you\u2019re finding it hard to focus, use the sound of the waves or a ticking clock as a guide to help you."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Stay in meditation for at least 15 minutes \u2013 starting off slowly will help you get used to the practice.")),mdx("h2",null,"7 benefits of meditation"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It reduces stress levels \u2013 If you\u2019re feeling stressed out, meditation is a great way to help you relax and find a state of calmness."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It helps you sleep better \u2013 Meditation has also been shown to help with sleeping better. This happens due to the reduction in stress levels that come from meditating."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It reduces negative emotions \u2013 When you meditate on a regular basis, you become more aware of your negative emotions such as anger and guilt. Meditation helps you deal with those emotions so you don\u2019t act on them."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It helps you become more self-aware \u2013 Meditation gives you the chance to look inside yourself and truly understand who you are."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It improves your attention span \u2013 If you\u2019re someone who struggles with keeping your attention on one thing for a long time, meditation is what you need. It helps you focus on one thing for a longer period of time."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"It makes you more compassionate \u2013 When you meditate on a regular basis, you become more compassionate towards other people.")),mdx("h2",null,"Key step: Turning up the volume on your senses"),mdx("p",null,"When you\u2019re in a meditative state, it\u2019s important to not only focus on your breathing but also on your senses. Start off by turning up the volume on your senses \u2013 what can you hear around you right now? What can you smell? What are the textures you feel when you touch something? If you were to see yourself as a camera, what would you focus on? While meditating, you have to make sure that you don\u2019t start thinking about your to-do list, work, or any other stressful thoughts. Instead, you have to focus on the present and be fully in the moment. This will help you take the edge off anything that\u2019s been weighing you down and help you truly relax."),mdx("h2",null,"4 more steps: Finding the spot where you\u2019re most comfortable"),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019re starting to meditate for the first time, it\u2019s important to find a place where you feel comfortable and relaxed. If you\u2019re sitting on the floor, make sure that you\u2019re not in a position that\u2019s uncomfortable. If you\u2019re sitting in a chair, try to find one that\u2019s not too hard. If you\u2019re lying down, make sure you\u2019re not in a position that\u2019s going to make you uncomfortable. Meditation is an exercise in being present, so you want to make sure you feel as relaxed as possible. Once you\u2019re comfortable, take a few deep breaths and let go of any thoughts or feelings that are weighing you down."),mdx("h2",null,"3 more steps: Letting go of any discomfort or pain"),mdx("p",null,"As we\u2019ve said above, you want to find a place where you\u2019re comfortable and relaxed. That said, if you\u2019ve got pain from an injury, you might have to move to a more comfortable position. Sometimes, sitting in one position will cause you discomfort or even pain \u2013 and that\u2019s okay as long as you don\u2019t let it distract you from your meditation session. Once you\u2019ve found a place where you feel comfortable and relaxed, let go of any pain you might be feeling. Close your eyes, take a few deep breaths, and let the pain go. Let it go from your mind and your body. The goal of meditation is to completely remove yourself from your daily life and all the stress and anxiety that comes with it."),mdx("h2",null,"2 last steps: Finding your mantra and concluding"),mdx("p",null,"A mantra is a word or a phrase that helps you focus on what you want from meditation. When you\u2019re beginning to meditate, it\u2019s better to choose a simple word such as \u201Ccalm\u201D or \u201Crelax\u201D. As you go further into your meditation, you can move onto more complex words. As you reach the end of your meditation, take a few more deep breaths. Slowly open your eyes and get ready to face the rest of your day."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"A Beginner\u2019s Guide To Meditation And Its Benefits You don\u2019t have to be a monk, a yogi or a zen master to meditate. In fact, you don\u2019t even have to sit cross-legged on the floor to get the benefits of meditation. All you need to do is sit somewhere comfortable and focus on your breathing. Whether you\u2019re trying to calm down before an important meeting or trying to get a grip on your anxiety and stress levels, meditation is just what you need!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 7 Exercises to Lose Weight in 7 Days

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The beginning of the New Year is a perfect time to focus on healthy habits and get off to a great start. With a strict diet, you will be able to burn fat effectively and efficiently, leading to weight loss in just a week. Exercising regularly not only helps you lose weight but also promotes long-term weight loss by increasing your metabolic rate and maintaining lean body mass.
Reducing fat from the body requires breaking down of fats in the body through physical activities. There are undoubtedly many reasons why people fail at losing weight, but most of them boil down to three simple things: lack of time, motivation, or knowledge. Fortunately, with these simple tricks you can lose weight in 7 days:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A healthy diet is a significant part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make a Workout Fun, Even If You Hate Working Out

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The unfortunate reality is that not everyone loves working out, and many people struggle to find activities they enjoy enough to continue on a regular basis. Some people hate it because of the physical discomfort, others because it\u2019s boring and feels like a chore, and for even more it\u2019s simply harder than they expected. . . Fortunately, there are plenty of ways to make your next workout fun again. Even if you hate exercising. Even if you feel unmotivated and drained every time you try. Working out doesn\u2019t have to be something you dread or look forward to only once in awhile. You just need the right strategies and techniques, which we\u2019ve outlined below as our top 10 ways to make a workout fun again, no matter how much you hate working out!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Self-Care When You're Busy
10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Get Fit without a Gym Membership

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s fast-paced society, most of us struggle to find time to exercise. While it\u2019s easy to overlook the benefits of exercising when you have a packed day, staying active can have a positive impact on your life. The American Council on Exercise states that being active has been proven as beneficial for mental and physical health as well as quality of life. The following are 5 ways to get fit without a gym membership.
With the rise in popularity of home gyms and personal training, more people than ever before are getting fit without stepping foot into a gym. In this article, we explore five ways you can get fit without joining a gym or purchasing an expensive home setup. Whether you have a small apartment or live in an area with limited outdoor activities, there are many different ways you can stay active and get fit without spending money on a gym membership or personal trainer.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
